revised_title: Luni-Solar Variations of Magnetic Declination and Horizontal Force at Bombay and Declination at Trevandrum
tldr: The author analyzes twenty-five years of declination observations and twenty-six and a half years of horizontal force observations taken at the Colaba Observatory in Bombay, as well as ten years of declination observations from Trevandrum. The study reveals luni-solar variations in magnetic declination and horizontal force, with the variations being related to each other in a definite manner. This is the first time such luni-solar variations have been described, and the author believes that expressing these variations in a compact form with a definite physical significance will help in discovering the underlying physical conditions.
